recipe.name: Taco Stack
recipe.description: Stacked tacos! These are made with layers of tortillas, Pork Carnitas (Mexican Shredded Pork) or Chicken, Corn and Tomato Salsa and melted cheese. Fun, fabulous and easy. If you make this with leftover Pork Carnitas then it's super quick too! Serves 2 very hungry people or 4 dieting people. Note: This stack is made with meat that is juicy and moist so all that is needed is a dollop of sour cream to finish it off. If you are concerned your meat is too dry, I suggest having a side sauce to add moisture.
recipeIngredient: 8  small tortillas (, corn or flour (around 6" / 12 cm rounds))
3 cups shredded Pork Carnitas or Quick Mexican Chicken ((see below))
1 1/2 cups grated cheese ((I used Monterey Jack. See Note 1 for other suggestions))
1 1/4 cups corn kernels (, fresh, frozen or canned (drained) (I used frozen))
1 punnet cherry tomatoes (, diced (or 2 medium tomatos, deseeded and diced, around 1 1/2 cups (Note 2)))
2  shallots / scallions (, green part only, sliced)
1/2  lime (, juice only (add more or less to taste))
1.2 lb / 600g   chicken thigh fillets (, skinless and boneless, cut into 1cm / 2/5" slices (Note 3))
1 tsp garlic powder ((or add 1 minced garlic clove into the oil in the fry pan))
Pinch of  cayenne or chili powder ((for heat - adjust to taste))

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare either the Pork Carnitas or Quick Mexican Chicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare either the Pork Carnitas or Quick Mexican Chicken.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the corn tortillas in the oven (I do it directly on the shelf) and bake for 3 to 5 minutes on each side, just to make them a bit stiff but not browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the corn tortillas in the oven (I do it directly on the shelf) and bake for 3 to 5 minutes on each side, just to make them a bit stiff but not browned.

recipeInstructions.text: Place a tortilla on a baking tray. Scatter 1/6th of the Pork Carnitas or Quick Mexican Chicken on the tortilla and top with Salsa (reserve some for Topping) then cheese. Place another tortilla on top and repeat, then again (so you end up with 3 layers of meat. Place the 4th tortilla on top. I don't put anything on it, but you could sprinkle some cheese if you want.
recipeInstructions.name: Place a tortilla on a baking tray. Scatter 1/6th of the Pork Carnitas or Quick Mexican Chicken on the tortilla and top with Salsa (reserve some for Topping) then cheese. Place another tortilla on top and repeat, then again (so you end up with 3 layers of meat. Place the 4th tortilla on top. I don't put anything on it, but you could sprinkle some cheese if you want.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 10 minutes until heated through and cheese is melted (it does not take long).
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 10 minutes until heated through and cheese is melted (it does not take long).

recipeInstructions.text: Top with remaining Salsa and Toppings of choice (I used sour cream, avocado, jalapeño and coriander/cilantro)
recipeInstructions.name: Top with remaining Salsa and Toppings of choice (I used sour cream, avocado, jalapeño and coriander/cilantro)

itemListElement.text: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large pan over high heat. Add the corn and sauté for a couple of minutes until charred to your liking. (This step is optional)
itemListElement.name: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large pan over high heat. Add the corn and sauté for a couple of minutes until charred to your liking. (This step is optional)

itemListElement.text: Allow to cool slightly, then toss with remaining Salsa ingredients.
itemListElement.name: Allow to cool slightly, then toss with remaining Salsa ingredients.

itemListElement.text: Defrost (if using frozen), then heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large fry pan over high heat.
itemListElement.name: Defrost (if using frozen), then heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large fry pan over high heat.

itemListElement.text: Add Pork Carnitas and cooking until the underside is golden brown (do not flip - Note 4).
itemListElement.name: Add Pork Carnitas and cooking until the underside is golden brown (do not flip - Note 4).

itemListElement.text: Remove from pan (scrape up all the brown bits) and set aside.
itemListElement.name: Remove from pan (scrape up all the brown bits) and set aside.

itemListElement.text: Combine all ingredients other than the oil in a bowl and toss to combine.
itemListElement.name: Combine all ingredients other than the oil in a bowl and toss to combine.

itemListElement.text: Heat the oil in a large fry pan over high heat.
itemListElement.name: Heat the oil in a large fry pan over high heat.

itemListElement.text: Add the chicken and sauté until browned and cooked through.
itemListElement.name: Add the chicken and sauté until browned and cooked through.

itemListElement.text: Remove chicken from the fry pan. Allow to cool then either roughly chop into smaller pieces or use a fork to "shred".
itemListElement.name: Remove chicken from the fry pan. Allow to cool then either roughly chop into smaller pieces or use a fork to "shred".

review.reviewBody: What a great idea to stack the tacos! These look so tasty and I love tacos of all kinds!

I admit my first instinct was how to eat it? But then I realized it doesn't matter at all! Yep, messy food is the best :)
Love the avocado and tomato toppings!
Cool! Stacked or not these look brilliant. I would prefer chicken :D
Hi Nagi! BIG BOLD TASTE! YUM! :)
